---

title:          "Check Out the New Components"
date:           2014-01-02T03:21:27.000Z
author:         Sam Grove
tags:           
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/New-Components/
---

<p>A few months back we <a href="/blog/entry/Tons-of-Freebies/">ran a promotion</a> giving
  <a
  href="/platforms">mbed-enabled platforms</a>and a shield in exchange for a <a href="/components">component database entry</a>.
    We&apos;re quite pleased with the results and wanted to share some of them
    with the community!</p>
<div style="padding: 10px; float:right">
  <p><a href="http://www.freescale.com/freedom" rel="nofollow"><img width="200" alt="Be on the lookout for more MBED enabled FRDM platforms!!" title="Be on the lookout for more MBED enabled FRDM platforms!!" src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/sam_grove/200xNxfreescale.jpg.pagespeed.ic.C3-CBBDXew.jpg"></a>

    <br>
    <br>
  </p>

<p>When starting your next project head over to the <a href="/components/status/">Components Database</a> and
  take a look around. Getting your next project started should be a snap.
  Here&apos;s a brief example</p>
<div class="flex-video">
  <iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/unttLbz07VY"
  frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
</div>
<p>You can also <a href="/forum/libdev/topic/4541/">check out the conversations</a> that
  went on during development. Lots of good tips and tricks to consider when
  developing with ARM Cortex M Microcontrollers.</p>
